co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.lib
Class IndexedObjectStore<T>

java.lang.Object
  co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.lib.AbstractDataset
      co.cask.cdap.api.dataset.lib.IndexedObjectStore<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects in the store
All Implemented Interfaces:
Dataset, MeteredDataset, co.cask.tephra.TransactionAware, Closeable
public class IndexedObjectStore<T>
extends AbstractDataset

An ObjectStore Dataset extension that supports access to objects via indices; lookups by the index will return all the objects stored in the object store that have the index value. The dataset uses two tables: an object store, to store the actual data, and a second table for the index.

IndexedObjectStore

public IndexedObjectStore(String name,
                          ObjectStore<T> objectStore,

Constructs the IndexedObjectStore with name and type.

Parameters:
name - name of the dataset

Method Detail

read

public T read(byte[] key)
See ObjectStore.read(byte[]).

read

public T read(String key)
See ObjectStore.read(String).

readAllByIndex

public List<T> readAllByIndex(byte[] secondaryKey)
Read all the objects from the objectStore for a given index. Returns all the objects that match the secondaryKey. Returns an empty list if no values are found. Never returns null.

Parameters:
secondaryKey - for the lookup.
Returns:
List of Objects matching the secondaryKey.

write

public void write(byte[] key,
                  T object,
                  byte[][] secondaryKeys)
Writes to the dataset, deleting any existing secondaryKey corresponding to the key and updates the indexTable with the secondaryKey that is passed.

Parameters:
key - key for storing the object
object - object to be stored
secondaryKeys - indices that can be used to lookup the object

write

public void write(byte[] key,
                  T object)

pruneIndex

public void pruneIndex(byte[] key,
                       byte[] secondaryKey)
Deletes an index that is no longer needed. After deleting the index, lookups using the index value will no longer return the object.

Parameters:
key - key for the object
secondaryKey - index to be pruned

updateIndex

public void updateIndex(byte[] key,
                        byte[] secondaryKey)
Updates the index value for an existing key. This will not delete the older secondaryKeys.

Parameters:
key - key for the object
secondaryKey - index to be pruned
